title_full: SLSPER01-BP01 Run performance tests at steady and burst rates
title: Run performance tests at steady and burst rates
description: Run performance tests on your serverless application using steady and burst rates. Use the results to tune capacity units and the provisioning model, then load test after changes to help select the best configuration for your workload.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP02 Choose appropriate API Gateway endpoint type for your use case
title: Choose appropriate API Gateway endpoint type for your use case
description: Use Edge endpoints for geographically dispersed customers to reduce latency through CloudFront edge locations. Use Regional endpoints for regional customers and when using other AWS services within the same Region to reduce inter-region latency.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP03 Test different Lambda memory settings and optimize static initialization
title: Test different Lambda memory settings and optimize static initialization
description: Test different Lambda memory settings since CPU, network, and storage IOPS are allocated proportionally to memory. Optimize static initialization code to reduce cold start impact. Consider provisioned concurrency for functions requiring consistent low latency.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP04 Use Lambda provisioned concurrency for consistent low-latency performance
title: Use Lambda provisioned concurrency for consistent low-latency performance
description: Use provisioned concurrency to initialize execution environments that respond immediately to invocations without fluctuations in latency. Configure Application Auto Scaling to manage provisioned concurrency on a schedule or based on utilization. Use scheduled scaling to increase provisioned concurrency before anticipated peak traffic.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP05 Configure Lambda VPC access only when necessary
title: Configure Lambda VPC access only when necessary
description: Configure Amazon VPC access for Lambda functions only when necessary. Set up a NAT gateway across multiple Availability Zones for high availability when VPC-enabled functions need internet access. Avoid DNS resolution of public host names for resources in your VPC; launch RDS instances with no-publicly-accessible option.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP06 Choose between Step Functions Standard and Express Workflows
title: Choose between Step Functions Standard and Express Workflows
description: Test Standard and Express Workflows for AWS Step Functions based on your workload. Consider per-second rates for both execution start rate and state transition rate. Express Workflows are optimized for high-volume, short-duration workloads with lower per-execution costs.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP07 Choose DynamoDB capacity mode based on traffic patterns
title: Choose DynamoDB capacity mode based on traffic patterns
description: Use DynamoDB on-demand capacity mode for unpredictable application traffic that can vary significantly. Use provisioned capacity mode for consistent, predictable traffic patterns to optimize costs and ensure consistent performance.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP08 Use Kinesis enhanced fan-out for multiple consumer scenarios
title: Use Kinesis enhanced fan-out for multiple consumer scenarios
description: Use Kinesis enhanced fan-out for dedicated input/output channels per consumer in multiple consumer scenarios. Use an extended batch window for low-volume transactions with Lambda to reduce the number of invocations while maintaining throughput.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP09 Monitor Lambda performance metrics with CloudWatch and AWS Compute Optimizer
title: Monitor Lambda performance metrics with CloudWatch and AWS Compute Optimizer
description: Monitor Amazon CloudWatch AWS Lambda performance and concurrency metrics to understand performance details about single invocations and instances processing events across functions. Use AWS Compute Optimizer to view machine learning-based recommendations for Lambda function memory sizes based on historical utilization.

title_full: SLSPER01-BP10 Consider provisioned concurrency cost tradeoffs
title: Consider provisioned concurrency cost tradeoffs
description: Configuring Lambda provisioned concurrency incurs charges to your AWS account. Consider which functions need to scale without fluctuations in latency and configure provisioned concurrency on specific versions or aliases. Balance the cost of provisioned concurrency against the latency requirements of your application.
